title: How to Access Email on a Computer, Phone, or Tablet

steps.title: Go to your email service provider's website.
steps.content: Go to your email service provider's website. If your email provider offers web-based email, you can access your email in a web browser like Microsoft Edge, Safari, Google Chrome , or Firefox . You'll just need the URL of the email provider you use, which can be provided to you by the company or organization that manages your email account. If you don't know the URL, contact your email provider, or find your provider in this list of common email services: Gmail : https://www.gmail.com iCloud (Apple): https://icloud.com/mail Yahoo Mail: https://mail.yahoo.com Outlook /Live.com/Hotmail: https://www.outlook.com AOL Mail: https://mail.aol.com Xfinity (Comcast): https://connect.xfinity.com/appsuite/ Spectrum: https://webmail.spectrum.net

steps.title: Type in your username and password.
steps.content: Type in your username and password. Once you’ve opened the web address of your email provider, you will see a login page. Enter your email account’s credentials (username and password) in the text fields provided. If you forgot your password, you can usually click the "Forgot Password?" link to reset it . If you remember your password, you can change it to something else within your email dashboard.

steps.title: Click the Next, Log In, or Sign In button to continue.
steps.content: Click the Next , Log In , or Sign In button to continue. You should now be able to access your email inbox. Most email providers require two-step verification to sign in to your email. If your provider requires this, they usually send a confirmation code to your mobile phone. If you are prompted to enter a code, check your cell phone or tablet—it may appear in your text messages, as a pop-up window, or in an authentication app. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the email app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open the email app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. Your phone or tablet has a built-in app that makes it easy to access email for your Google account (on Android) or iCloud account (on iOS). If you're using If you're using an Android, your phone or tablet comes preinstalled with the Gmail app. Opening the Gmail app will open the Gmail inbox for your Google account, which you used to log in to your Android. On an iPhone or iPad, you can use the Mail app to send and receive email from your iCloud account. If your email address ends with @icloud.com, @me.com, or @mac.com, just tap this app on your Home screen to access your email. If you want to access a different email account, you can download the app for your email provider, such as Yahoo Mail or AOL Mail, from the Play Store (Android) or App Store (iPhone/iPad).

steps.title: Set up your email account.
steps.content: Set up your email account. If it's the first time you're using this app to access email, you may be asked to log in and choose your preferences. Supply any information requested to set up your email app. If you want to use the email app on your phone to access a different email address, such as the one you use for work, school, or through your internet provider, you will need to add your email account to the app. These guides will help: How to Add Another Email Account to Gmail How to Add a Gmail Account to iPhone or iPad How to Add Another Email Account to the iPhone Mail App

steps.title: Wait for the email app to sync.
steps.content: Wait for the email app to sync. If you just added a new email account to your phone, it may take a few moments for your emails to download to your phone or tablet. After syncing, your inbox will show all the messages you have. From here on, you can access your email account’s inbox and send and receive messages using your gadget’s native mail app.

steps.title: Open the Mail app on your Windows 10 PC.
steps.content: Open the Mail app on your Windows 10 PC. The Windows Mail app makes accessing almost any email account easy, including your Microsoft email account (@outlook.com, @live.com, @hotmail.com), Gmail, and your work, school, or ISP's email account. You'll find the Mail app in your Start menu. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you're using Windows 11, the Mail app is now the new Outlook app, a lightweight version of the original Microsoft Outlook application. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To learn how to use it, jump down to Using New Outlook on Windows 11 . Not sure which version of Windows you have? Press the Windows key on your keyboard (or click the Windows menu), type mail , and then press ↵ Enter . If you see a message that says "Windows Mail and Calendar are no longer supported," you are using Windows 11. If not, you have Windows 10.

steps.title: Click Add account on the welcome screen.
steps.content: Click Add account on the welcome screen. If it's your first time setting up the Mail app, you'll see a pop-up asking you to set up email. If you don’t see this, click Settings (the gear icon) on the left, click Manage Accounts, and then click Add account . [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Enter the email address you want to access and click Continue.
steps.content: Enter the email address you want to access and click Continue . Depending on the email address you're adding, you'll be prompted to enter a password or additional server information.

steps.title: Enter your password and click Continue.
steps.content: Enter your password and click Continue . Depending on your email provider, this may be all you need to do to access your email. For other providers, you may be prompted to Select provider , or enter your IMAP server information. The IMAP server address should be provided to you by your email service provider.

steps.title: Open the new Outlook app.
steps.content: Open the new Outlook app. If you're using Windows 11, you can set up and access your email in the new Outlook app. To open it, press the Windows key on your keyboard (or click the Windows menu), type outlook , and click Outlook in the search results. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If you are prompted to log in, log in with your Microsoft account, which is the same email address and password you use to sign in to Windows. You can use Outlook to access email from most email addresses, including ones that end with @outlook.com, @icloud.com, @gmail.com, and @yahoo.com.

steps.title: Click the View tab.
steps.content: Click the View tab. You will find this tab at the top of the new Outlook app. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the View Settings button.
steps.content: Click the View Settings button. This is the button with a gear icon at the upper-left corner of the window. When you click it, the Settings window will open.

steps.title: Click the Accounts tab.
steps.content: Click the Accounts tab. This is in the left panel. If you have already set up an email account in Outlook, you will now see it in the right panel.

steps.title: Click Add account in the right panel.
steps.content: Click Add account in the right panel. This opens a sign-in screen.

steps.title: Enter the email address you want to use and click Continue.
steps.content: Enter the email address you want to use and click Continue . For example, if your email address is example@gmail.com, type it into the field, then click the Continue button. If you don't have an email address yet, you can create one now. To do so, click the link next to "No account?" to create a brand new email address that ends with @outlook.com.

steps.title: Enter your password and follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Enter your password and follow the on-screen instructions. Depending on your email provider, you may be asked to provide additional details, such as your "POP" or "IMAP" server address, "SMTP" address, or other bits of information that may sound confusing. If this happens, just contact your email provider to request that information. Once you've finished adding your email to Outlook, you can easily access your email at any time by opening the Outlook app.

steps.title: Open the Mail app on your Mac.
steps.content: Open the Mail app on your Mac. If you want to access email in your Mac's Mail app, it's easy. You can use the Mail app to access your iCloud email (@icloud.com, @mac.com, or @me.com), or add a different email address like Gmail, Yahoo, Microsoft Exchange, AOL, or most work or school accounts.

steps.title: Select an email provider and click Continue.
steps.content: Select an email provider and click Continue . If you haven't already set up the Mail app, you'll be prompted to select a mail account provider now. If you see your provider on the list, select it. If not, select Other Mail Account . [7] X Research source If you are not prompted to select an email provider, click the Mail menu, select Accounts , and then click Add account .

steps.title: Log in to your email provider.
steps.content: Log in to your email provider. For most email providers, you should be able to enter your email address and sign in to link your email account to your Mac instantly. If you selected Other Mail Account and your email provider is not found, you may be prompted to enter the POP, IMAP, and SMTP server addresses for your provider. You will need to get these addresses from your email service provider. You can use the Mail app on your Mac to access email from most email addresses, including ones that end with @outlook.com, @icloud.com, @gmail.com, and @yahoo.com.
